Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix

Class LUDecomposition4x4

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix.LUDecomposition4x4
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class LUDecomposition4x4 extends Object implements Serializable
Fast 4x4 LU decomposition with unrolled loops, partial pivoting, and no memory copies. At instantiation the matrix A, and b, from the system A*x = b is passed in. The user is free to fill A, and b as many times as desired. Calling solve() overwrites b with x. A and b can be reused as many times as desired. If they are recreated then a new LUDecomposition4x4 object must be created to support the new definition, or the function set(A, b) can be called.
Author:
jrhipp

  • Constructor Details

    • LUDecomposition4x4

      public LUDecomposition4x4(double[][] A, double[] data)
      Standard constructor. Sets the input matrix A, and r.h.s vector data as the solution containers. These can be filled by the caller in whatever fashion. Calling function solve() overwrites data with x from A*x = data.
      Parameters:
      A - The L.H.S. matrix.
      data - The R.H.S. vector.

  • Method Details

    • set

      public void set(double[][] A, double[] data)
      Sets the input matrix A, and r.h.s vector data as the solution containers. These can be filled by the caller in whatever fashion. Calling function solve() overwrites data with x from A*x = data.
      Parameters:
      A - The L.H.S. matrix.
      data - The R.H.S. vector.

    • solve

      public void solve()
      Solves the LU decomposition and forward and back substitution of the result. On exit the input matrix b has been assigned the solution values (x).
